title: Senior Cloud Engineer – Central Technology
content:
The Cloud Engineer will be a member of Zynga’s Infrastructure vertical, in a team responsible for maintaining Zynga’s Cloud Infrastructure, SaaS products used across Zynga Studios. We specialize in propagating standard methodologies across all backend engineering teams. Our team collaborates closely with every major mobile studio at Zynga!
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
We prototype and test new in-house & vendor-supplied tools, managed-services, deployment and application frameworks. Consult on their relative feature sets, performance and applicability to various product teams.
Cloud Engineering members build, document, maintain, and support tools that can be used across the company for infrastructure-related tasks and tech modernization.
We partner with other business units to convert manual business workflows and requirements into application code.
Our team works with studio partners to upgrade their code for updated OS and application stacks.
The entire team participates in crafting playbooks and helping other studios during on-call.
We administer roles, policies and network resources in a multi-account/cloud environment. Tier one support for related change requests.
We assist other teams in vetting application development standard methodologies and security guidelines.
DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
We are looking for fresh perspectives and eager candidates to grow within our team. A BS/CS, 1-2 years in a professional Developer / Operations / Administration role or equivalent experience would be an excellent fit.
Experience building, refreshing and containerizing web applications developed in LAMP/NoSQL, and MVC frameworks for centralized operational automation.
Understands SDLC tenets and development methodologies for rapid development and automated testing.
Experience working on Linux VMs and Containers hosted in Cloud providers is a plus!
Have experience coding infrastructure orchestration tools like Puppet, Chef, Terraform, and Cloudformation? We love that.
Desired experience automating processes via command line tools like AWS CLI to replace GUI operations, so if you love python and golang, we do too!
Desired experience working in small teams / startup environments.
Candidates practiced in software development processes are highly valued.
Must have experience working within a commercial cloud environment such as AWS or relevant Cloud Certifications.
Must have practical experience with Enterprise Linux environments, development, deployment (green/blue via CodePipeline, etc.), maintenance, monitoring, debugging, and orchestration patterns.
Must have strong English written and verbal skills. You are encouraged to engage with customers over video conferencing, ticketing systems, and chat. You thrive writing clear procedural instructions (Runbooks), conceptual overviews (Architecture), and implementation guides.
You provide phenomenal customer service and can communicate appropriately with different roles in a company (team members, vs customer engineers and customer producers, etc.).
WHAT WE OFFER YOU
Competitive salary, bonus plan and ESPP (Employee Stock Purchase Plan)
401K Company Match Contribution (US)
RRSP/DPSP company match contribution (Canada)
Health coverage, dental, disability, critical illness, EAP, and life insurance (Canada)
Medical, dental, vision, EAP, life insurance, and disability benefits (US)
Virtual mental health and neurodiversity support programs
Global Fitness reimbursement program
Global Wellbeing Program
Financial wellness program with unlimited access to certified financial planners
Discretionary Time Off policy for many employees
Family planning support program
Generous paid parental, pregnancy-related disability, caregiver, and compassionate leaves
Subsidized Back-up child care
Zynga happy hours and frequent employee events
Flexible working hours on many teams
Culture of diversity and inclusion including employee resource groups
Work with cool people and impact millions of daily player

As part of our Diversity and Inclusion Strategy we would like to collect demographic information from job candidates to identify and implement strategies to understand and improve equal opportunity for all at Zynga. Completion of this information is entirely voluntary and any details you provide will not be considered in the hiring process. Zynga will anonymize demographic information for reporting and analytics to gain a better understanding of our hiring process. This  information will only be used internally within Zynga and stored securely on our systems.  

For Zynga’s full privacy notice, click here for US Job Applicant privacy notice and here for the Outside of the US Job Applicant Privacy Notice . You can email Privacy@zynga.com for more information regarding the collections and use of your data.
